I have list with elements:               l = {1.000000000*10^-2076, 2.052685846*10^-1865, 7.337942425*10^-1741,      6.994455902*10^-1652, 2.007623567*10^-1582, 2.482890841*10^-1525,      8.737178026*10^-1477, 1.673592426*10^-1434, 5.183426213*10^-1397,      2.634095605*10^-1363}      I want to make a list l2, where each element i is equal to 1 - l[[i]]. So I made:               For[i = 1, i <= Length[l], i++, a = l[[i]]; b = 1 - a;        l2 = AppendTo[l2, b]];      But as a result I have :               l2 = {1.000000000, 1.000000000, 1.000000000, 1.000000000, 1.000000000,      1.000000000, 1.000000000, 1.000000000, 1.000000000, 1.000000000}      What is wrong, because if I will take the first element from l               a = 1.000000000*10^-2076      b = 1 - a = 0.99999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999\     9999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999\     9999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999\     9999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999999\ How can I convert l to l2, to have the good precision?
